skill.name: check-plan
skill.description: Audit implementation progress against a plan, verify completed work, identify remaining tasks, and validate quality. Use when user asks to check plan status, verify implementation, see what's left to do, or validate plan completion.
skill.summary: Audit implementation progress against a plan, verify completed work, identify remaining tasks, and v...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: This is a read-only audit skill that analyzes implementation progress against plans. It only reads files and runs validation commands, never modifying code. The skill uses standard development tools (git, TypeScript, linting) for quality verification.

low_findings.title: Git command execution for audit purposes
low_findings.description: The skill executes git commands (git status, git diff, git log) to understand the scope of changes. This is necessary for the audit functionality but represents external command execution.

low_findings.title: File system access for plan reading
low_findings.description: The skill reads plan files from .plans/ directory and examines implementation files. This read-only access is required for the audit functionality.

content.value_statement: Developers struggle to track if their implementation matches the original plan requirements. This skill provides comprehensive auditing to verify progress, identify gaps, and ensure 100% completion before marking plans as done.
actual_capabilities: Audits implementation against plan requirements with 100% coverage verification
Verifies REMOVAL SPEC items are actually deleted from codebase
Maps original issue requirements to implementation status
Runs TypeScript and linting validation checks
Generates detailed progress reports with completion percentages
Creates actionable task lists for remaining work
limitations: Read-only audit - cannot fix issues, only identify them
Requires existing plan files in .plans/ directory
Depends on git for change tracking and history
Cannot validate runtime behavior, only code structure

use_cases.title: Verify feature implementation completeness
use_cases.description: Check if all planned features from a complex implementation plan are actually coded and working correctly.

use_cases.title: Validate pull request against requirements
use_cases.description: Ensure PR implementation covers 100% of original issue requirements before approving merge.

use_cases.title: Track development progress accurately
use_cases.description: Get precise completion percentages and identify exactly what's blocking project completion.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Plan Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the status of my current implementation plan. Show me what's complete and what's still needed.

prompt_templates.title: Pre-Merge Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit my implementation against the plan to ensure all requirements are met before I merge this pull request.

prompt_templates.title: Issue Coverage Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if my implementation covers 100% of the original GitHub issue requirements, not just the plan steps.

prompt_templates.title: Removal Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify that all items in the REMOVAL SPEC have been properly deleted and no old code remains in the codebase.

best_practices: Run check-plan before marking any implementation as complete to catch missed requirements
Always verify REMOVAL SPEC items are deleted - old code can cause security issues
Check original issue requirements, not just plan steps, for 100% coverage
anti_patterns: Assuming plan completion equals issue resolution - always verify original requirements
Skipping validation checks - TypeScript and linting errors indicate incomplete work
Ignoring partial implementations - mark clearly and track remaining work

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No, check-plan is read-only. It audits your implementation but never edits files.

faq.question: What if I don't have a .plans directory?
faq.answer: The skill will ask you to specify which plan file to check, or help identify plans from your project structure.

faq.question: Can it check plans from other AI assistants?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with any structured plan format and validates implementation regardless of who created the plan.

faq.question: How does it handle partial implementations?
faq.answer: It marks items as PARTIAL with percentage completion and lists exactly what work remains to be done.

faq.question: What validation does it perform?
faq.answer: It runs TypeScript type checking, linting, build verification, and checks for proper typing without 'any' types.

faq.question: Why check original issue requirements?
faq.answer: Plans can miss requirements. The skill ensures your implementation solves the original problem, not just follows the plan.
